title: Understanding Data Quality Dimensions
text: Data quality dimensions are criteria used to assess the quality of data. Common dimensions include: $$1$$. Completeness: Ensures all required data is present. $$2$$. Uniqueness: Ensures no duplicate records exist. $$3$$. Consistency: Ensures data is consistent across different datasets. $$4$$. Validity: Ensures data conforms to defined formats or rules.

title: Identifying the Issue
text: The issue here is that the age recorded is $$150$$ years, which is highly unlikely for a human. This suggests that the data does not conform to realistic or expected values.

title: Choosing the Dimension
text: The issue with the age being recorded as $$150$$ years relates to which data quality dimension?
